intro: Ceropegia portae-taurinae, commonly known as the Taurine Ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish, with a unique structure that attracts specific pollinators. Ceropegia portae-taurinae is a succulent plant, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves.
